Code RequirementsÔÉÅ

The criteria outlined represent the essential requirements that the code needs to fulfill for successful execution and optimal performance.

1pip install pep8
2pip install --upgrade pep8

 1# Example following PEP8 style guide
 2def calculate_avg(numbers):
 3    # use Descriptive variable names
 4    total = sum(numbers)
 5    count = len(numbers)
 6
 7    # Spaces in between symbols. Ex: >, <, >=, # etc...
 8    if count > 0:
 9        #Caculate average if there are elements in the list
10        average = total / count
11        return average
12    else:
13        #return None if the list is empty
14        return None
  • PEP8

    • Readability: Enforces consistent and clear coding style. Easier for developers to understand and maintain

    • Provides a standard set of conventions that Python programmers can follow. Making it easier to collaborate

    • Tools and automation such as Black 23.3.0 (python install package) can automatically check your code for style violations.

      • I beleive VS Code has an extension that will automatically do this if run say python black myfile.py

    • Using PEP8 can help codebase evolve and grow over time.

  • Docstring/Google Docstring

    • Both are the same, however, I personally think Google docstring is cleaner.

 1# This is Docstring
 2"""
 3Return the difference in days between the current date and game release date.
 4
 5Parameter
 6---------
 7date : str
 8    Release date in string format.
 9
10Returns
11-------
12int64
13    Integer difference in days.
14"""

1 # Google docstring
2 """Return the difference in days between the current date and game release date.
3
4Args:
5    date (str): Release date in string format.
6
7Returns:
8    int64: Integer difference in days.
9"""
